intro: Ruellia anagallis, commonly known as the common ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from blue to purple, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ruellia anagallis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
